result.execSummary:
The defendant Eddie J Wilkinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments.  Cash bail to apply.  Remaining cash bail to be returned to poster.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Report in Date: September 9, 2014 at 5 pm. If defendant fails to report, all community access is cancelled.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Credit for 3 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eddie J Wilkinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DENYING, request for electronic monitoring.  Order signed and filed.  Copy sent to parties.  aw
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.

Defendant Eddie J Wilkinson in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.


Report in Date: September 9, 2014 at 5 pm.
If defendant fails to report, all community access is cancelled.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments.  Cash bail to apply.  Remaining cash bail to be returned to poster.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Defendant Eddie J Wilkinson in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 9/5/2014 at 8:30, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Eddie J Wilkinson in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for plea hearing.  Defendant just started federal probation.  Defendant to give treatment verification to his attorney.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 7/14/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
COURT ORDERED THE REMAINDER OF BALANCE $1,000.00 TO BE RETURNED TO THE REMITTER.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.

Defendant Eddie J Wilkinson in court with attorney Mark E Kershek.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing. Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any illegal drugs or weapons, and to follow all the conditions of bail. Defense would like to be heard as to bail. COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eddie J Wilkinson in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel may want to file a bail motion.  Case adjourned for counsel to review discovery with client on 4/21/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Eddie J Wilkinson in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Nathaniel Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Eddie J Wilkinson

Prior: 5363 North 38th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Eddie J Wilkinson in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
